title: Did the United States enter WWI for their own imperial gains? - Quora

response.answer_text: What could you be thinking of? The US turned down postwar League of Nations mandates for Armenia and Palestine for example. WWI produced British, French, and Japanese imperial gains. This was a reason why many Americans were hesitant to fight for Britain a second time.

No, not really. They joined because of the Zimmermann Telegram although the Sinking of the RMS Lusitania didn’t help Germany’s case. They also, by the way, didn’t join to ‘defend democracy’ or any of those other little propagandistic lies that get told.
